descriptivenote.p: Collection material in English and Russian.

corpname.part: American Folklife Center, Library of Congress

did.abstract: Collection of field recordings and photographs from ethnomusicologist Margarita Mazo's fieldwork with Molokan and Old Believer communities in Russia, Poland, and the United States. Also included are Mazo's academic research files and materials from her work for two Smithsonian Folklife Festivals.

processinfo.head: Processing History
processinfo.p: The Margarita Mazo Old Believer and Molokan collection was processed by Sara Ludewig and Carolina Restrepo in May and June 2023.

Matthew Young, a Russian Specialist in the Library of Congress Latin American, Caribbean, and European Division, transcribed tapes with labels written in Cyrillic script. Young Romanized the transcriptions according to the
Library of Congress Romanization Standard for Russian
. In cases where Mazo had already Romanized the text, the original Romanizations were retained. In cases where a word or letter was illegible, a question mark appears in parentheses. Sara Ludewig photographed all the original cassette tapes and their carriers. The photographs of these items are available upon request.

Sara Ludewig assigned materials digital ID numbers (DC numbers) during processing. She removed duplicates and mildly rearranged files prior to processing each DC into individual archival information packages (AIPs).

userestrict.head: Copyright Status
userestrict.p: The rights in this collection held by Margarita Mazo are governed by copyright for the full duration under copyright law. Additionally, Molokan materials may not be duplicated without Mazo's permission. According to acquisitions forms on file with AFC, after Mazo's lifetime, permission for duplication of Molokan materials must be granted by the Molokan communities of origin. Rights belonging to third parties may be governed by copyright and other restrictions.

accessrestrict.head: Access and Restrictions
accessrestrict.p:
The Margarita Mazo Old Believer and Molokan collection is open to research. To request materials, please contact the Folklife Reading Room at
https://hdl.loc.gov/loc.afc/folklife.contact

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Researchers wishing to cite this collection should include the following information: [item, date, container number], Margarita Mazo Old Believer and Molokan collection (AFC 2022/003), American Folklife Center, Library of Congress, Washington, D.C.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Margarita Mazo is a professor emerita at the Ohio State University, where she founded a program in Cognitive Ethnomusicology. She holds a PhD from the Leningrad (St. Petersburg) Conservatory where her research focused on Russian music. She has held teaching positions at the Leningrad (St. Petersburg) Conservatory, the New England Conservatory of Music, and Harvard University.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Collection of field recordings, photographs, and manuscripts created by ethnomusicologist Margarita Mazo. Mazo's research and fieldwork focuses on two sects of Spiritual Christians that split from the Russian Orthodox Church: Molokans and Old Believers. Mazo's research explores music and religious expression for these two religious sects and the ways diasporic communities maintain and adapt traditions. The collection includes documentation of Molokan and Old Believer communities in Stavropol, Tula, and Moscow, Russia and in Poland as well as diasporic Molokan and Old Believer communities in California, Oregon, and Pennsylvania in the United States.

Mazo was also involved with planning two Smithsonian Festivals of American Folklife. In 1988, Mazo was the Program Curator for the Music from the Peoples of the Soviet Union portion of the Festival and in 1995, she was one of the curators for the Russian Roots, American Branches portion of the Festival. Planning documents, photographs, and recordings from her work with the Festivals are included in the collection. Also included are Mazo's academic research files on Molokans and Old Believers as well as article drafts, correspondence, and other administrative or academic files.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The Margarita Mazo Old Believer and Molokan collection is organized in 9 series:

item.ref: Series 1: Festival of American Folklife, Washington, D.C., 1988-1995
Series 4: Tula and Moscow, Russia fieldwork, 1987-1994

arrangement.p: The Festival and fieldwork series are divided into subseries by date of the research trip. Materials are organized within each subseries by material format. Sara Ludewig transcribed folder titles as they appeared on the original folder. In cases where there was no title on the original folder, Ludewig supplied a title which appears in brackets.

controlaccess.head: Selected Search Terms
controlaccess.p: The following terms have been used to index the description of this collection in the LC Catalog. They are grouped by name of person or organization, by subject or location, and by occupation and listed alphabetically.

corpname.part: Festival of American Folklife (1988 : Washington, D.C.)
Festival of American Folklife (1995 : Washington, D.C.)

did.unittitle: Series 1: Festival of American Folklife, Washington, D.C.

scopecontent.p: Mazo was a Program Curator for the Music from the Peoples of the Soviet Union portion of the 1988 Smithsonian Folklife Festival. The Festival featured musicians and performers from the Soviet Union who participated in an exchange with American musicians who later traveled to Russia to perform.

scopecontent.p: Mazo was one of the curators for the Russian Roots, American Branches: Music in Two Worlds portion of the 1995 Smithsonian Folklife Festival. The Festival featured musicians from Russia, the Ukraine, and other former Soviet republics as well as musicians from Old Believer and Molokan communities in the United States.

scopecontent.p: Field recordings, field notes, song analyses, and photographs from Mazo's fieldwork with Molokan communities in Stavropol, USSR (now Russia).

scopecontent.p: Correspondence, photocopies of secondary source articles in both Russian and English, and Mazo's reading notes, all used to conduct general research on Old Believer communities in the United States and Eastern Europe.

scopecontent.p: Drafts of articles and other academic papers and presentations written by Margarita Mazo.

did.didnote: Versions and drafts of academic articles written by Mazo. Article titles include: "'We Sing as We Live:' Molokans in Russia and United States," "The Verbal and the Musical in Molokans' Life," "Singing as Experience Among American-Russian Molokans," "Russian Roots, American Branches," "A Report on a Joint Research Project on Molokan Communities in the Soviet Union and United States." Also includes research files about Molokan and Old Believer communities.

odd.head: Appendix A: Tape Original ID Concordance
odd.p: Concordance matching Mazo's original tape ID numbers with the AFC assigned SR numbers. Mazo's numbering system was inconsistent and often has duplicate tape IDs. As a result, Sara Ludewig assigned each tape an AFC SR number. Mazo's tape indexes and field notes often contain references to the original tape ID numbers. This concordance can be used to match the new SR number with Mazo's original ID number. Tapes that appear in this list with no value in the Mazo's ID Number column did not have an original ID number.
